Energy did not enter the universe. Universe has infinite volume. So why do you think that the energy had entered the universe(into an infinite volume) from a place that had finite volume? Although energy can neither be created nor be destroyed yet it can be converted from one form to another. Heat, light, sounds, radiations- all are forms of energy. Even mass is energy. Mass and energy are interconvertible. Think about the amount of energy the universe has in the form of mass. Energy can neither be created nor be destroyed. This means that there is no other universe from which we can bring energy into our universe. Similarly we cannot dump the energy into another universe from our universe because no other universe exists. Our universe is everything. Everything is in the universe. Universe basically has energy in different forms. Whatever happens, happens in this universe only and the energy is either absorbed from this very universe or released into this universe only. Where can the energy go? Suppose in a nuclear reaction an object is completely destroyed. But the energy is always conserved. It is converted into heat and different kinds of radiation. Now, where will the heat and radiations go? You can bring a cold object to “destroy” some heat but the object itself will become hot in the process. You can neither destroy nor create energy. You could do so if scientists had not considered mass and energy the same thing. But alas, they know that mass can be converted to energy.
